comments.text:
Does it work better if you disable hardware acceleration (in Tools->Options->Advanced) ?

Since Firefox 4.0, the Microsoft DirectWrite library is used for rendering fonts (if available). That is the reason that you see differences with a Firefox 3.6, or with a Firefox 6.0 on Linux for instance. Some fonts benefit, some fonts suffer. The behavior should be the same as in IE 9.

But your User-Agent says that you're running Windows XP, which doesn't have DirectWrite. On the other hand, your screenshot seems to indicate to me that you're running Windows 7 ??? What is it ?

I have FF 64.0.2 64 bit on Windows 7 Enterprise SP1 up to date
